model.resources

Class Banker

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.resources.Banker

  • public class Banker
extends java.lang.Object
    The Banker handles all transactions in or out of the Bank
    Version:
    1.0 Build Jan, 2016.
    Author:
    Christian Riboldi, Clayton Condie, Jacob Brewer, Joshua Powers, Joshua Van Steeter

      void buyDevCard(int playerIndex)
      Purchases a development card by paying the bank.

      The banker pays out the desired resources to each of the players.

      • Banker

        public Banker()

    • Method Detail

      • payPlayers

        public void payPlayers(ResourceList[] resLists)
        The banker pays out the desired resources to each of the players.
        Parameters:
        resLists - An array of ResourceLists where the index of the ResourceList is the same as the index of the Player being paid.

      • buyPiece

        public void buyPiece(int playerIndex,
                     PieceType piece)
        This function is the implementation for buying pieces from the bank.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the player who is purchasing the piece.
        piece - The PieceType which will be bought.

      • buyDevCard

        public void buyDevCard(int playerIndex)
        Purchases a development card by paying the bank.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Index of the player who is buying.

      • tradeWithBank

        public void tradeWithBank(ResourceList resList,
                          int toPlayerIndex)
        This moves the requested resources to the player who is trading with the bank.
        Parameters:
        resList - ResourceList with the positive numbers going to the player and the negative numbers coming from the Bank.
        toPlayerIndex - The index of the player who is trading with the bank.

      • useYearOfPlentyCard

        public void useYearOfPlentyCard(int playerIndex,
                                ResourceList resourcesAskedFor)
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the player who is using the card.
        resourcesAskedFor - The ResourceList with the two resources requested.
